item.dc:creator: @Pyro Pyro
item.description:
@Pyro wrote:

Nice 1337 macro. you could use timeouts instead though. But this works just aswell so that it doesnt eat at awkward moments. And yes there are a few things in srl that are more like scripts. For example the ability to make a autofighter almost entirely with a few procs from srl.

item.title: RealEatIfNeededTime(foodcolor, Eathp, minutes: Integer; foodlogout: boolean);
item.dc:creator: @1337_macro 1337_macro
item.description:
@1337_macro wrote:

{******************************************************************************* RealEatIfNeededTime(foodcolor, Eathp, minutes: Integer; foodlogout: boolean); By: 1337_macro Description: Will check hp, eat if needed, and logout if out of food *******************************************************************************} 

place this in your main loop before the repeat

MarkTime(RealEatIfNeededMark)
procedure RealEatIfNeededTime(foodcolor, Eathp, minutes: Integer; foodlogout: boolean);
begin
  if ((TimeFromMark(RealEatIfNeededMark) / 1000) / 60 >= minutes) then
  begin
  MarkTime(RealEatIfNeededMark);
    Writeln('Checking Hp');
    begin
if(GetHp<= EatHp)and(FoodColor>= 0)then
 begin
  GameTab(4);
  wait(10 + random(20));
  if(FindColorSpiraltolerance(x, y, foodcolor, 560, 210, 730, 460, 2))then
   begin
   MMouse(x + 2, y - 2, 6, 5)
   if(IsUpText('Eat'))then
    begin
    GetMousePos(x, y);
    mouse(x, y, 3, 2, true);
    end;
   end
    Else
   begin
    if(FoodLogout)then
     begin
     logout;
     Players[CurrentPlayer].Active:= false;
       end;
      end;
     end;
    end;
  end;
end;

Read full topic
item.source: RealEatIfNeededTime(foodcolor, Eathp, minutes: Integer; foodlogout: boolean);
